newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak SAX index eases on blue chips losses.
newsitem.headline: Slovak SAX index eases on blue chips losses.

text.p: Blue chip losses ppulled the Bratislava Stock Exchange's SAX index down 1.91 points to 201.88 in listless trading on Monday.

Gas storage firm Nafta, oil refiner Slovnaft, steel maker VSZ and bank VUB all lost ground and brokers said blue chips in general were currently suffering from a lack of liquidity, though the trend may soon change.
"I think the market is awaiting dividend announcements in these companies, which are expected soon," Dusan Sykora of ING Barings said.
Sykora pointed to Slovnaft which eased 10 crowns to 980, but traded only 129 shares.
Overall volume increased to 322,626 shares, from 59,918 shares traded on Friday, while turnover rose to 102.96 million crowns, from 42.80 million.
